title: You have 2.2 mol Xe and 1.7 mol F₂, but when you carry out the reaction you end up with only 0.25 mol XeF₄. What is the percent yield of this experiment? Xe(g) + 2 F₂ (g) → XeF₄ (g) - Quora

response.answer_text: Xe is in excess so would expect 1.7/2 = 0.85mol XeF4 so % yield is 0.25/0.85 x 100 = 29.4%
